segments.text: Good morning , Mr.Black . I am the new secretary .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Good morning , Miss White . You are half an hour early .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't want to make a bad impression .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Come on over . This is your desk , and this is your time card . Be sure to clock in and out before and after you work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: One more thing , keep your desk neat . It's the rule . There is no exception , even the art designers have to keep their desks neat .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'll keep that in mind . Does everything on the desk belong to me ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not belong . You can use them as long as you work here . When you quit , you â€™ ll have to return them to the company .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What's the extension number for my phone ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The operator will put all your calls through . You don't have to worry about that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can I make personal phone calls during my office hours ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course you can . Every one has his personal matters to deal with more or less , but don't chat over the phone . What's more , don't let it hinder your work and the company's business .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When you settle down , I'll show you around and introduce you to the department managers .
segments.speaker: S2
